intro: Pyrola media, commonly known as the common wintergreen, is a low-growing evergreen herbaceous plant native to the northern hemisphere. It typically forms dense mats of foliage and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in the spring. The plant is characterized by its oval, leathery leaves and is often found in shaded, moist woodland environments. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. Pyrola media is known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
